repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->
Allows user to set the keymap for cycling through `signature_help`.

comment_data.body: It would be helpful to include an example of how to configure this.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1821,7 +1821,8 @@ rename({new_name}, {opts})                              *vim.lsp.buf.rename()*
 
 signature_help({config})                        *vim.lsp.buf.signature_help()*
     Displays signature information about the symbol under the cursor in a
-    floating window.
+    floating window. Allows cycling through signature overloads by mapping
+    `<Plug>(CycleSignature)`.

comment_data.body:
We should better scope the name here:
```suggestion
--- `<Plug>(LspCycleSignature)`.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -345,7 +345,8 @@ local sig_help_ns = api.nvim_create_namespace('nvim.lsp.signature_help')
 --- @field silent? boolean
 
 --- Displays signature information about the symbol under the cursor in a
---- floating window.
+--- floating window. Allows cycling through signature overloads by mapping
+--- `<Plug>(CycleSignature)`.

comment_data.body: Remove the last argument. `noremap` is useless in `vim.keymap.set` and is entirely ignored (it checks `remap` instead).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1821,7 +1821,12 @@ rename({new_name}, {opts})                              *vim.lsp.buf.rename()*
 
 signature_help({config})                        *vim.lsp.buf.signature_help()*
     Displays signature information about the symbol under the cursor in a
-    floating window.
+    floating window. Allows cycling through signature overloads by mapping
+    `<Plug>(LspCycleSignature)`.
+
+    Example: >lua
+        vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-s>', '<Plug>(LspCycleSignature)', { noremap = false })

comment_data.body: Done, thank you.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1821,7 +1821,12 @@ rename({new_name}, {opts})                              *vim.lsp.buf.rename()*
 
 signature_help({config})                        *vim.lsp.buf.signature_help()*
     Displays signature information about the symbol under the cursor in a
-    floating window.
+    floating window. Allows cycling through signature overloads by mapping
+    `<Plug>(LspCycleSignature)`.
+
+    Example: >lua
+        vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-s>', '<Plug>(LspCycleSignature)', { noremap = false })

comment_data.body:
Let's following the same "dot" convention as we do for namespaces, autocmds, etc.
```suggestion
      vim.keymap.set('n', '<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)', function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -420,7 +433,7 @@ function M.signature_help(config)
     local fbuf, fwin = show_signature()
 
     if can_cycle then
-      vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-s>', function()
+      vim.keymap.set('n', '<Plug>(LspCycleSignature)', function()

comment_data.body:
No
```suggestion
            can_cycle and ' (<C-s> to cycle)' or ''
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -387,7 +395,12 @@ function M.signature_help(config)
       end
 
       local sfx = total > 1
-          and string.format(' (%d/%d)%s', idx, total, can_cycle and ' (<C-s> to cycle)' or '')
+          and string.format(
+            ' (%d/%d)%s',
+            idx,
+            total,
+            can_cycle and ' (<Plug>(LspCycleSignature) to cycle)' or ''

comment_data.body:
`<C-s>` should still be the default. Otherwise everyone has to map it manually now?

IOW, map to both. Skip the default `<C-s>` mapping if a mapping to the `<Plug>` mapping exists.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -420,7 +433,7 @@ function M.signature_help(config)
     local fbuf, fwin = show_signature()
 
     if can_cycle then
-      vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-s>', function()
+      vim.keymap.set('n', '<Plug>(LspCycleSignature)', function()

comment_data.body: Is there a way to get the "real" left-hand side of the mapping in case the user has changed the default `<C-s>` mapping?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -387,7 +395,12 @@ function M.signature_help(config)
       end
 
       local sfx = total > 1
-          and string.format(' (%d/%d)%s', idx, total, can_cycle and ' (<C-s> to cycle)' or '')
+          and string.format(
+            ' (%d/%d)%s',
+            idx,
+            total,
+            can_cycle and ' (<Plug>(LspCycleSignature) to cycle)' or ''

comment_data.body:
Was thinking about that too. Thought of this, but it feels kinda bad:

```lua
    local existing_cycle_sig_mapping = nil
    for _, map in ipairs(vim.api.nvim_get_keymap('n')) do
      if map.rhs == '<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)' then
        existing_cycle_sig_mapping = map
      end
    end
```

Also, is there even a way to check if it's mapped at all? Regarding this:

> Skip the default <C-s> mapping if a mapping to the `<Plug>` mapping exists.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -387,7 +395,12 @@ function M.signature_help(config)
       end
 
       local sfx = total > 1
-          and string.format(' (%d/%d)%s', idx, total, can_cycle and ' (<C-s> to cycle)' or '')
+          and string.format(
+            ' (%d/%d)%s',
+            idx,
+            total,
+            can_cycle and ' (<Plug>(LspCycleSignature) to cycle)' or ''

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
    local keymap = nil
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -373,6 +381,13 @@ function M.signature_help(config)
     local can_cycle = total > 1 and config.focusable ~= false
     local idx = active_signature - 1
 
+    local existing_cycle_sig_mapping = nil

comment_data.body: should not need to iterate through all normal-mode mappings. see if `vim.fn.maparg()` provides a way to get what you want
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -373,6 +381,13 @@ function M.signature_help(config)
     local can_cycle = total > 1 and config.focusable ~= false
     local idx = active_signature - 1
 
+    local existing_cycle_sig_mapping = nil
+    for _, map in ipairs(vim.api.nvim_get_keymap('n')) do
+      if map.rhs == '<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)' then

comment_data.body:
> should not need to iterate through all normal-mode mappings. see if `vim.fn.maparg()` provides a way to get what you want

Looked into it, it returns the rhs for the `{name}` parameter, but I need the lhs for `<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -373,6 +381,13 @@ function M.signature_help(config)
     local can_cycle = total > 1 and config.focusable ~= false
     local idx = active_signature - 1
 
+    local existing_cycle_sig_mapping = nil
+    for _, map in ipairs(vim.api.nvim_get_keymap('n')) do
+      if map.rhs == '<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)' then

comment_data.body: `hasmapto()`
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -373,6 +381,13 @@ function M.signature_help(config)
     local can_cycle = total > 1 and config.focusable ~= false
     local idx = active_signature - 1
 
+    local existing_cycle_sig_mapping = nil
+    for _, map in ipairs(vim.api.nvim_get_keymap('n')) do
+      if map.rhs == '<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)' then

comment_data.body: yes `hasmapto` is what I was thinking of, thanks zeer
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -373,6 +381,13 @@ function M.signature_help(config)
     local can_cycle = total > 1 and config.focusable ~= false
     local idx = active_signature - 1
 
+    local existing_cycle_sig_mapping = nil
+    for _, map in ipairs(vim.api.nvim_get_keymap('n')) do
+      if map.rhs == '<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)' then

comment_data.body: nice, but it doesn't give me the lhs of the mapping, right? should I just use `hasmapto` and leave the message as it was?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -373,6 +381,13 @@ function M.signature_help(config)
     local can_cycle = total > 1 and config.focusable ~= false
     local idx = active_signature - 1
 
+    local existing_cycle_sig_mapping = nil
+    for _, map in ipairs(vim.api.nvim_get_keymap('n')) do
+      if map.rhs == '<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)' then

comment_data.body:
iterating through mappings just to show a better description message is not a sustainable pattern. if we want to do that kind of thing, it needs to be done in a maintainable way. implementing lots of code for every case like this is not acceptable.

for now use `hasmapto` to support the basics, and can we revisit improving the UI later
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -373,6 +381,13 @@ function M.signature_help(config)
     local can_cycle = total > 1 and config.focusable ~= false
     local idx = active_signature - 1
 
+    local existing_cycle_sig_mapping = nil
+    for _, map in ipairs(vim.api.nvim_get_keymap('n')) do
+      if map.rhs == '<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)' then

comment_data.body:
keymap.set defaults to non-recurse map. recursion is required to map to a `<Plug>` mapping
```suggestion
        vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-b>', '<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)', {remap=true})
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1821,7 +1821,12 @@ rename({new_name}, {opts})                              *vim.lsp.buf.rename()*
 
 signature_help({config})                        *vim.lsp.buf.signature_help()*
     Displays signature information about the symbol under the cursor in a
-    floating window.
+    floating window. Allows cycling through signature overloads with `<C-s>`,
+    which can be remapped via `<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)`
+
+    Example: >lua
+        vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-b>', '<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)')

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
          remap = true,
          buffer = fbuf,
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -420,12 +428,18 @@ function M.signature_help(config)
     local fbuf, fwin = show_signature()
 
     if can_cycle then
-      vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-s>', function()
+      vim.keymap.set('n', '<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)', function()
         show_signature(fwin)
       end, {
         buffer = fbuf,
         desc = 'Cycle next signature',
       })
+      if vim.fn.hasmapto('<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)', 'n') == 0 then
+        vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-s>', '<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)', {
+          buffer = fbuf,

comment_data.body: I think this hasn't been needed since https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/0347875a5c11258ebb6377a1ab79b04fe9c55bc9

@@ -1821,7 +1821,12 @@ rename({new_name}, {opts})                              *vim.lsp.buf.rename()*

+
+    Example: >lua
+        vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-b>', '<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)')

comment_data.body: oh wow, that is... heretical yet awesome!

comment_data.body: sorry, let's revert, since it's less verbose

comment_data.body: alright
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1821,7 +1821,12 @@ rename({new_name}, {opts})                              *vim.lsp.buf.rename()*
 
 signature_help({config})                        *vim.lsp.buf.signature_help()*
     Displays signature information about the symbol under the cursor in a

+    floating window. Allows cycling through signature overloads with `<C-s>`,

comment_regular_data.body: This isn't a maintainable way to customize keymaps. As suggested in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31029#issuecomment-2453338904, `<Plug>` mappings feel like a cleaner solution here.
Right, that does look better. Will get back to it.

Hey, thanks for the feedback. Here's the updated code - now using `<Plug>` mappings as suggested. This might be sufficient, but I'd appreciate confirmation or further guidance. Ready for review when you have time.
I don't know enough about plug mapping to properly review this. @lewis6991/@justinmk perhaps you could take a look too?
Included a lua example and changed the `<Plug>` name.
waiting on the requested changes, else this is wontfix
hey, got caught up with work and school, but should clear up this week

Hey, this is good for review, whenever you have a chance. It keeps `<C-s>` as the default.

> Was thinking about that too. Thought of this, but it feels kinda bad:
> 
> ```lua
>     local existing_cycle_sig_mapping = nil
>     for _, map in ipairs(vim.api.nvim_get_keymap('n')) do
>       if map.rhs == '<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)' then
>         existing_cycle_sig_mapping = map
>       end
>     end
> ```
> 
> Also, is there even a way to check if it's mapped at all? Regarding this:
> 
> > Skip the default  mapping if a mapping to the `<Plug>` mapping exists.

I did leave this in, but let me know if I should remove it.

Hello, I'm trying to do this as documented: `vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-space>', '<Plug>(nvim.lsp.ctrl-s)')`, but the binding in the new buffer remains `C-s`. Is it possible this is not working correctly?
Hey, I don't think this has been released yet. Are you on v0.11.3?

Ah, that would explain it. Yes, I'm on 0.11.3. I installed `--head` with brew and confirmed it works, thanks @tiagoinaba! I'll workaround until it's released.

But I did find a bug: on HEAD, the page cycle counter stays on 1/x even though the pages cycle, but on 0.11.3 with ctrl+s it increments correctly.
Yeah, I just checked and indeed something broke on master. Still works on my branch, though. Will have to bisect later tonight.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: feat(lsp): signature help cycle binding
